name: Class number problem
summary:
In mathematics, the Gauss class number problem (for imaginary quadratic fields), as usually understood, is to provide for each n â‰¥ 1 a complete list of imaginary quadratic fields 
  
    
      
        
          Q
        
        (
        
          
            d
          
        
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle \mathbb {Q} ({\sqrt {d}})}
  
 (for negative integers d) having class number n. It is named after Carl Friedrich Gauss. It can also be stated in terms of discriminants. T
